benchmark_details.name: CodeHaluEval
benchmark_details.overview: The CodeHaluEval benchmark is designed to systematically evaluate code hallucinations in large language models (LLMs), categorizing hallucinations into four main types and using a dynamic detection algorithm called CodeHalu.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and understand code hallucinations in large language models to improve their code generation capabilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focus is primarily on Python programming language.

data.annotation: Code hallucinations categorized into four types.

methodology.calculation: HR = 1/N * Î£ S(i, K) where S(i, K) indicates if the i-th sample is a hallucination.
methodology.interpretation: Lower HR indicates less frequent hallucinations in generated code.
methodology.baseline_results: Results vary by model, with rates between 20% to 60% across evaluated models.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation through execution tests of generated code.
